title: Grenadier Guard keels over in the jungle after walking into broken branch during mock casualty drill
text:
This is the eye-watering moment a soldier walks into an upturned branch in the jungle and keels over after injuring his genitals.

The video shared on the Grenadier Guards' Twitter page shows the group of soldiers armed with SA80 rifles carrying a fellow troop on a litter.

The soldiers were taking part in a mock casualty evacuation exercise in the dense vegetation.

The soldiers were taking part in a mock casualty evacuation exercise in the dense vegetation

During the task, a soldier at the back of the group notices a protruding branch and tries to step over it.

But the unfortunate soldier gets caught in the groin, causing severe pain.

He then keels over backwards while groaning, causing the other soldiers to stop and turn around.

The accident also led to the soldier in the litter being dropped on the ground.

The Grenadiers shared the video with the caption: 'Maintaining your 360-degree battlefield awareness is essential in the jungle... you never know what it has in store for you next.'

The video has since been shared and liked hundreds of times with many sharing in the soldier's pain.

The Grenadier Guards is one of the oldest and most iconic infantry regiments in the British Army, dating back to 1656.
description: The video shared on the Grenadier Guards' Twitter page shows the British soldiers armed with SA80 rifles carrying a fellow troop on a litter. But one unfortunate soldier is then impaled by a branch.
